usages_consistent: Line 288: error message f"Git operation timed out after {GIT_TIMEOUT_SECONDS} seconds"

codenames_explained: tack: Pinterest scheduling service (pins to boards)
zuck: Facebook integration (named after Facebook founder)
gandalf: Auth service (gatekeeper, you shall not pass)
swanson: Billing service (Ron Swanson - manages money)
charlotte: E-commerce (Charlotte the spider - weaves product webs)
dolly: Create/template service (Dolly Parton - creates hits)
pablo: Media service (Pablo Picasso - handles images)
scooby: Scraping service (Scooby-Doo - sniffs out URLs)
aero: Dashboard service (aerial view of everything)

observations.description: Constant naming is clear and follows Python conventions (SCREAMING_SNAKE_CASE)
Component keyword documentation is thorough with mnemonic explanations that aid memory
Docstring at line 168 says 'Times out operations after 30 seconds' - could reference constant name for consistency, but acceptable for documentation readability

summary.rationale: All HIGH and addressed MEDIUM issues have been properly fixed. The internal codename documentation is comprehensive and will significantly help future maintainers. The GIT_TIMEOUT_SECONDS constant is used consistently. Thread-safety documentation is clear. The remaining unaddressed issues are LOW severity and acceptable for merge.
